intro: Daucus infestus, commonly known as the hairy parsley or wild carrot, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp that splits into two one-seeded parts when mature. Daucus infestus is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showcasing its adaptability to various environments.
